website_summaries.verdict: A durable, easily programmable keyboard that feels good to type on, with plenty of customization for gaming.
pros: Sturdy build and solid feel despite its plastic material
Keys are springy and instantly responsive
Backlighting is cool, and doesn’t affect vision when playing in dark rooms
cons: Wrist rest can fall off easily or slide around
Chroma colors don’t work unless driver software is installed and active
A few find the key clicking too loud

website_summaries.verdict: A good hybrid keyboard for those looking for something in between a mechanical and a membrane keyboard.
pros: This keyboard features mecha-membrane keys, which have a soft membrane dome with a crisp click like mechanical keys
Includes a wrist rest and multi-colored backlight that is fully customizable
Keeps up with even the quickest typing
cons: The wrist rest starts to wear fairly quickly

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: So far I have been very pleased with this keyboard. There is one annoying thing. The keys are "transposed" (best way to describe it). For example. If you want to look at the "?" key - Normally this key has a "?" above the "/", indicating a "Shift" is needed. On this keyboard all "Shift"ed keys are labeled BELOW the normal character.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Kyboard
customer_reviews.text: You have to love Razer for it's legendary quality and functionality. I needed low profile keys and a soft touch.. This KB provided.. The case is surprisingly sturdy and well assembled. I have always wanted a Razer KB.. This KB is actually not a true mechanical folks.. It is membrane KB with little springs attached to the holes that hold the keys. I would have preferred a mechanical, but didn't want all the racket they so often make, and most of the true mechanicals also have mountains for keys that hurt my hands to use, so this one fit the bill.. Thanks...
customer_reviews.author: Aurihazuma

customer_reviews.title: Keys worn off in less than one year with mild use
customer_reviews.text: I can’t even begin to express my disappointment in this keyboard. It cost $85 and the keys wore off in less than one year. I didn’t use any cleaners on the keys. I don’t have sweaty hands. I am not overly aggressive with how I type. I take extra care of my electronics, and to see this happen with such care is unacceptable. Not only that, but Razer customer service was “kind” enough to offer me replacement keys for $26. Even though the keyboard is still under warranty. Don’t buy this product. Don’t buy a Razer keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: KCO

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard. Razer interface is rough.
customer_reviews.text: I had this recommended SOOOO many times by my gaming group. Like half of them have one and never said a bad thing about it. It feels good and is no where nearly as loud as my actual full mechanical keyboard, which is a perk for me and everyone in Discord. My only complaint is how confusing the interface for profiles was. Like I downloaded some from the legit website for them and they just didn’t work. Found the same ones on Reddit and they work great. So pro tip if you don’t make your own use the Reddit.
customer_reviews.author: Kaguya

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Middle Ground
customer_reviews.text: I've always had a certain dislike for mesh keyboards, aswell as mechanical Keyboards, But after trying this at a friends house, I almost immediately bought this keyboard. To date this is probably one of the best keyboards i've ever owned, It types well, Is extremely responsive, and the included magnetic wrist rest is superb and keeping my hands cramp-free. If they made another one just like this a year or so down the line i'd buy it again without question.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfy Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard works great and feels great! The wrist rest is very comfy and at the perfect height. The mechanical click of the keys is very satisfying and don't get annoying after a while, unlike other keyboards. The RGB is very vibrant and very customizable with Razer Croma. My only complaint is the printed symbols on the number and character keys are opposite compared to a standard keyboard. For instance, the period key would normally have the right arrow printed on top, with the period printed on bottom. On this keyboard, the period is printed on top while the right arrow is printed on bottom, making this keyboard awkwardly different from every other keyboard I use.
customer_reviews.author: Michele H.

customer_reviews.title: Lights dont always work and not compatible with Linux
customer_reviews.text: I received this item yesterday and used it one time. The lights would only work sometimes. Would have to keep unplugging and plugging in and hope they come on. And for some reason, the keys are not compatible with Debian Linux OS. I would hit the " in the keyboard and the linux CMD would show > . Ill stick with my $20 Red Dragon keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing keyboard with Razer Chroma
customer_reviews.text: The profile of these keys are absolutely perfect. I mistyped way too frequently on my last keyboard because the keys were just too dang high. On top of that, Razer Chroma is AMAZING! Like many gamers, I love RGB lighting. Chroma allows you to customize the RGB lights to your heart's content. Right now I have it customized to where the keyboard flickers like a fire, but everytime I hit a key or click my Razer mouse it radiates color down the keyboard. There are so many different effects, and with the community you can get so many pre-programmed settings to take any thought out of the process. The customization is endless.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bundle problems...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this keyboard as a bundle with the Trinity mouse but, for some reason, they shipped separately and the mouse is still MIA 4 days after the keyboard showed up... so, only giving 3 stars, for now. As far as the keyboard goes, it's been pretty good overall. Unfortunately, I still can't get Razer's Synapse 3 software to install on my machine... It starts installing and then, nothing. The Synapse 2 software does install though and works well. The feel of the keyboard is good but, the keys are pretty tightly spaced together... still getting used to that. When (if) the mouse shows up, I'll update this review further.
customer_reviews.author: Honest reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Gaming or General Use
customer_reviews.text: The Razer Ornata Chroma Gaming Keyboard is probably the one of the best keyboards I've ever used. Being an accountant and using tons of different keyboards throughout my career, I can say with no hesitation that the keys on this board feel sturdy, well made, and satisfying to press. The hybrid mechanical key switches feel great. For gaming, the board is set up ergonomically with stands on the back and a wrist rest pad in that front (detached), so you can game comfortably for hours. The buttons are responsive and quick as well. The RGB setting are pretty cool as you can change the way the board lights up and the colors.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is great when you first open it but it doesnt last long. I kept hearing people call it inconsistent and i didnt get that but it really is. The keys dont all have the same consistent feedback or audible click and they feel like they are a bit unstable on the pillars that they slide down on so sometimes they feel like they get stuck at the top and are awkward to type on. The pad is actually really nice and works perfectly with the magnets. The colors are alright although razer synapse is annoying. Honestly I would return this keyboard but I already threw out the box. More buttons sticking now
customer_reviews.author: ryan

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not for gaming
customer_reviews.text: Keys seem responsive and all until you start gaming on it for hours on end. That is normally 3-4 most weekdays. Then it starts degrading. 4 months later and the esc key sticks. The space bar is lopsided because if you use WASD your finger is definitely not moving to the center and it only has one switch on it. Guess where? The center! Very bad design on that. You definitely need a keyboard with two switches for the spacebar. Light programs are good, and beautiful. Wrist rest is okay, but I don't even attach it to the board anymore because my hands are bigger then whomever they based this off of.
customer_reviews.author: Jon C

customer_reviews.title: A bit noisy
customer_reviews.text: I originally had a fully mechanical keyboard, which was super loud, so I went for this with a new build. It isn't really noisy, but it isn't silent. Colors/customizability and the wrist rest are awesome, would have loved to see some dedicated volume control switches on the keyboard, but the Function Keys volume control will have to do.
customer_reviews.author: King Gregory

customer_reviews.title: It does not connect with the software all the time.
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard does not connect with the software. The lighting and commands sometimes don't work because the keyboard and software are not connected. So the lighting pattern changes and I have to go back into the software and reboot it, which is pretty annoying.
customer_reviews.author: TheCyclistPhotographer.

customer_reviews.title: Not a hybrid, read review.
customer_reviews.text: So this is a membrane keyboard with plastic things to make a click sound. Within a day of using, a key went dead and would no longer rebound after being typed. Returned immediately and bought a true mechanical keyboard. If you are ok with a membrane keyboard, they can be had for much less than what you are paying for RGB lights and hype.
customer_reviews.author: KayakFisherman

customer_reviews.title: Clean, crisp keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: very pretty keyboard. feels like chicklet keys with a much deeper press and a crisp satisfying click when you press the keys. it actually feels pretty great. easy to customize and set up macros with the software. it also has the nicest wrist rest I've ever had the pleasure to use. (usually they suck so i don't use them) but this one feels wonderful. it's like a sofa for your wrists. i use this particular one all the time. it's also magnetic so you can pop it off if it's in the way or you need a little more desk space for a small project.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Sako

customer_reviews.title: Upside down??
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I needed a nice keyboard for work (i.e. I am not using this as a gaming keyboard). It is a nice keyboard. I like the wrist support and the keyboard feel is great. What I had not realized is that the symbols on the keys are flipped. The shift symbol is below the non-shift symbol. For example, the '>' symbol is under the '.' on the key these two symbols share. The keyboard functions as it should (i.e. when you hit this key without the shift you get a '.'). This has caused a few moments of confusion but I am sure I will get use to this (shouldn't be looking at the keys anyway).
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Decent hardware, horrible software
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a membrane keyboard for gaming and typing for work, and this keyboard fit the bill. The keyboard is nice and sturdy, and the wrist rest is fantastic. The braided cable is a nice touch. The keys feel tactile, and they have a soft (but not mushy) feeling when they bottom out. I like the hardware. However, Razer synapse keeps erasing my profile and lighting settings. It's horrible. It updates (or tries to ask me for them) all the time. What kind of data could a gaming peripheral company possibly need to collect from its users? The intrusive software is really putting me off from purchasing any more Razer products or recommending to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: but typing with this keyboard makes me pretty happy. Nice clean clicks
customer_reviews.text: So, turns out i'm a Razer fan-boy. I didn't think i was, but typing with this keyboard makes me pretty happy. Nice clean clicks, not a lot of travel till activation (makes it feel "fast") and perfect lighting. Only thing that made me think i was going crazy is that the shift-characters (all the special characters you'd normally use the shift key to type) are on the bottom of the key, not the top like every other keyboard on the market. Apparently, this is because the LED for lighting is at the top portion of the key, so this helps it shine through the main character for the key.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel

customer_reviews.title: It's noisy until you remove the metal inserts, don't refund cuz of noise!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first and probably the last keyboard I'll buy. It seems like it'll last forever, not even that, eventually when this one gets used up and stopps working, I'm gonna buy it again. If the noise is a issue for you, buy a keyboard silencer kit on Amazon but don't buy the ones that come with the silencer rings, just buy the key remover and there's a metal insert in under the keys that you remove that make the keys quiet. There is a YouTube video especially for this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Blao

customer_reviews.title: Awesome keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I'm not an expert on PC gaming, I'm just an enthusiast. To me, this product is a keyboard with cool lights. The keys click comfortably. The Razer studio is awesome and allows you to create some super cool light settings or choose from great presets. The cable is long and wrapped, which I think is great. The wrist rest is magnetic, so it's easy to remove or attach. I got this keyboard on sale, and overall I'm extremely happy with it. No complaints and I would highly recommend it. Go Razer.
customer_reviews.author: Justa Custa Ma

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! Except the wrist pad could be a higher quality
customer_reviews.text: I love the keyboard! I am an IT technician so computers are life. For me being a woman the keys are perfect. This is the Goldilocks of keyboards - razers anyways. Black widow is nice but the keys are tall and it is a lot of hand/wrist movement. The deathstalker is a nice chicklet keyboard but long days of typing there isn't much cushion. Ornata is just that perfect in between plus the wrist pad even with poor quality is nice because it is magnetic so doesn't slide around. The colors are way better and brighter then the deathstalker chroma - keys look like they hover! Worth the purchase
customer_reviews.author: blah777

customer_reviews.title: I have never typed so fast!! So beautiful, INCREDIBLY FUNCTIONAL!!
customer_reviews.text: I LOOOOVE This keyboard! It's beautiful. I love the rainbow fade, however, the best part is the mechanical feedback. I have never typed so fast before! They keys feel firm and yet I can fly across the keyboard. I can't say it enough, I LOVE this thing!! The keyboard feels incredibly sturdy and you can feel the quality. I love that it also came with a wrist pad (note, if you use the wrist pad, make sure to use the tabs on the back of the keyboard to elevate the rear and put the keys at an angle)
customer_reviews.author: Nick and Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Great overall keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this is a very good keyboard. I bought this as my first gaming keyboard and absolutely enjoyed using it. The mecha-membrane switches by Razer were greatly made within the manufacturing of this keyboard. Typing or gaming, this keyboard will not disappoint. Not to mention that used properly with the Razer Synapse software the lighting behind the keys are beautiful. At their brightest, they are very bright, especially at night. You are given the option to dim the lighting and/or change the lighting effect. Given with a very comfortable wrist rest, the keyboard is overall great all-around, and I recommend it for anyone who is looking for a keyboard between the clicky mechanicals, or the softer membranes.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Totanes

customer_reviews.title: Best Mechanical Keyboard Ever!
customer_reviews.text: Best mechanical keyboard I've ever used. I have used Logitech, Redragon, and other brands, but this one is hands down the best. It's not as loud and functions great. The keys are mid-sized so they don't pop out very high and just feels great overall. My only minor gripe is that my product in particular was uneven when raised so I keep it flat, however, keeping it flat is ergonomically better for my wrist anyway so I really don't mind.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Jung

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied feels
customer_reviews.text: I was attracted by the feel of this fake mechanical feeling, I have few mechanical keyboards. I love the build and the diligent light it shine from the inside. it also have very soft cushion that can support while you typing. The wire designed is a smart play. you can place the wire through the top or side. it wouldn't be hard to fold like other mechanical keyboard . One thing i notice after many days of uses is that, I don't actually recommend this keyboard if you are a typer or gamer because it require quite a lot of force to press the key. It feel tired sometime when you type too often.
customer_reviews.author: kevin T

customer_reviews.title: Much more than expected
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t do a ton of research on the programmable backlit keys. I mostly wanted this for the mechanical keys and the ability to have the colorful keys. I was pleasantly surprised with how much you can do with the key lights. I didn’t realize I could program each section to have its own effect (or a couple of effects). That’s awesome. I was also really pleased with the quality of the keyboard. I had a flimsy Amazon basics keyboard before this and it’s a massive upgrade. I love that the wrist bad has a little magnet that makes it stay in place against the keyboard. That’s a nice touch. I’d highly recommend this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Stephens

customer_reviews.title: Keys are much stiffer than expected
customer_reviews.text: Being a membrane keyboard I wasn't expecting the amount of force required to press some of the keys. Maybe there's something wrong with mine but the space bar in particular feels like it requires twice the force as most of the other keys. I've missed 5 spaces between words just writing this review. Returning it. Still looking for a good, quiet keyboard with a backlight that doesn't have all the extra media key garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Eppinghoff

customer_reviews.title: Gaming Keyboard with 4 Year Protection
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is well-made and came at a price that best or normal brick and mortar retail. For the total purchase price of about 70 bucks (with the 4 year Protection plan), it beats the 99 dollar price tag at stopped with a optimal two year warranty. I'm impressed by the coverage and I enjoy the braided cable. The keys are slim, sitting at mid height and had a nice mechanical click. The color settings are enjoyable, I only wish you could link them to the computer temperature so it would display certain colors when the temperature fluctuates. Will update later on a year or two in to see how it wears.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Campos & Bree Rohde

customer_reviews.title: I really like the feel and look of this keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard is very programmable only drawback as it doesn't have our memory so you can't unplug it from the computer with the software and plug it into one that doesn't it just lights at the default color. Looks like you need a pro model to get the programming to save on the keyboard. also don't bother signing in with Google it never works can't reach the server as soon as I just signed in with an email everything worked fine for signing in.
customer_reviews.author: Triko

customer_reviews.title: It’s just awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly it’s just been a reliable keyboard for the price. Keys feel nice and responsive, rgb lighting is pretty awesome, and overall I just like the fact my wrist are well rested on the cushion it brought. Takes extra space but worth it if you mix it in with a similar ergonomic mouse pad, which I also did from Razer. Only complain isn’t really a complain cause this happens with almost all mechanical keyboards but always keep a can of compressed air present to blow off the dust and dirt that gets inside the keys or else some keys might stay pressed and require multiple presses to detach from button.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new keyboard when my widow chroma's lighting shorted on half the keys. Super rare for them but I was the lucky one who didnt have warranty left :P This was a cheap alternative and honestly I really enjoy it. I dont really keybind/macro my keys too much other than in World of Warcraft and it works for that. For FPS it also has good reaction time. I enjoy the color and being able to customize - As I was able to with the widow. 10/10 Keyboard and great price for what you get.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Rose

customer_reviews.title: Highly highly need to buy
customer_reviews.text: I love these keyboards. I am a dispatcher and this keyboard I could not work a day without. I ended up buying 3 of them for each of my computers. Hand rest is durable and oh so soft. Keys when pressed is like heaven itself. Light modes and macros are great and come with premise selections. I keep the hard plastic cover that it comes in over the keys. Perfect dust cover and protector. Razor is a great company in itself.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: came with 10 dead keys
customer_reviews.text: seriously 10 dead keys on a new product is ridiculous. otherwise the tactile response was about as good as the free keyboards that come with dell desktops. the keys are not mechanical. the keyboard has a veneer of cheapness to it. i had a logitech g710+ that broke after 5+ years of usage because of a spill and this keyboard made that one seem like the greatest thing on earth.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Cartwright

customer_reviews.title: This is my favorite keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I love my Ornata. One has been on my main setup for a couple of years now. Of all the keyboards I've owned, nothing quite meets its comfort, design, and downright dependability. Feels great when typing, and the noise is satisfying- and not /too/ loud. Compared to your standard crunch mechanical keyboarding: the noise is about half. I'm only disappointed that the hand rest wears down relatively quickly. It feels great too, just a shame that the leatherette begins peeling off. Simply put, if you want traditional layout & fine quality- buy it.. You won't regret spending the money.
customer_reviews.author: Clark

customer_reviews.title: Best Membrane, but not comparable to Mechanical
customer_reviews.text: I am impressed with the feel they managed to get out of membrane switches, and the backlight modes are pretty darn neat. The keys developed some sort of "sticky" delay on release, but I am not sure if this is some sort of break-in issue or something else. Key macros and layouts are sensible, although nothing special. As a basic gaming keyboard, it's fine, as well as for doing a lot of typing, although have a personal preference for less "click" and a more positive feel.
customer_reviews.author: J. Walter

customer_reviews.title: this will provide it just fine. Bought it for use in my office as ...
customer_reviews.text: So the keyboard is constructed very well and if you're looking for a light-show, this will provide it just fine. Bought it for use in my office as a upgrade to a chicklet keyboard. Some cons in this scenario: first, the keys are LOUD. I'm probably going to replace it just for this reason. Second, the mechanical "click" and the keypress occur at different times. You can press a key, hear/feel a click but the button won't register.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Tobin

customer_reviews.title: Solid keyboard at a good price
customer_reviews.text: Very nice keyboard. Feels good to type on thanks to the clicks, which aren't as loud as a real mechanical keyboard (but that's also why I got this instead of the noisy Blackwidow). Plenty of color combos and setups that you can play with. Wrist rest is decent, does its job. My only gripe is that the color settings don't save when you aren't logged in. You instead get the default color spectrum fade until you log into your desktop. This is disappointing considering even cheap Chinese keyboard I used to have was able to keep my color settings even when I wasn't logged in.
customer_reviews.author: Judgement0s

customer_reviews.title: A must have gamer keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: Ah man i cant even believe to understand how my board keeps runing due to the punishment it has dealt with. The orginal keyboards i have used feel mushy and uncormfortable compared to my razor. I have spilt 4oz of whiskey onto the board and after a couple days of drying it remained working like a dream. The light up features are really nice for night gamers as you can see the actual keys for those game with odd keybindings.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Attractive keyboard but no manual
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is very easy to type on and I like it very much. Unfortunately no manual was present so I have no idea what other things it is capable of doing. I tried getting a manual online and what was offered was not easy to read. The other thing that surprised me is I have to take my watch off as it gets in the way of the wrist pad and is uncomfortable wearing it. Other than that, the wrist pad is very comfortable so it is more positive than negative.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Frost

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 5 weeks
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard stopped working and Amazon won't replace it. Been trying to get a hold of Razer. What a joke that is. I thought it would be a great keyboard for my son, but no, we're back to Logitech. This keyboard is trash. :( UPDATE: Changed the stars to 3 because Amazon came through with a refund. Keyboard is still trash tho.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would love them to have better signage consistency
customer_reviews.text: As someone who always used Logitech keyboards for work and gaming but recently switched a lot of my stuff to razer... Razers key layout is so inconsistent I have two keyboards and a Razer blade 13 inch. Not one of them have the same layout on their keys. It's minor and annoying changes. Like the numbers below the symbols in this keyboard but the symbols above in the Razer blade. Same for the punctuations and math symbols.
customer_reviews.author: Andres

customer_reviews.title: I love the clicky keyboard sound and the RGB lighting is stunning!
customer_reviews.text: The clickiness of the keys really sold this keyboard for me! I use it for regular work and gaming and it's very responsive and I love it! However, because of the mecha-membrane key clicks, keys can sometimes have irregular feelings if pressed too often (for example, the AWSD keys click a bit differently than other keys that aren't used as often.) Regardless, I don't notice it too much and it doesn't bother me, but it may bother others who are more sensitive to the feel. Overall, I really love this keyboard and the sound is super pleasing for me!
customer_reviews.author: CM

customer_reviews.title: Really like typing on this but not so much gaming
customer_reviews.text: I prefer flat style keys for gaming personally but typing on this thing feels amazing. I make far less mistakes and can type faster than any other keyboard I've tried. Key presses are just a bit loud especially if you button mash while gaming. But the wrist rest is on point. My wrists don't hurt after long sessions and I'm at the computer a lot. The chroma lighting is nice though, fits well with my rgb build. But it's a good price for the quality. This was a good buy and I'm pretty picky
customer_reviews.author: Smelly

customer_reviews.title: A nice keyboard for the right price
customer_reviews.text: I don't game on my PC that much, but because I've been working from home more lately, I've been wanting to improve my setup so it can be more comfortable to use. That being said, this keyboard has a nice, soft plastic feel to it, but it also looks like greasy fingers are prone to stain keys more easily. So wash your hands, folks. The keyboard also installs a software driver that allows you to manipulate the RGB color scheme and how the colors appear or change pattern or lighting. All in all, I'm pleased with this keyboard. It feels amazing and it was an affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: Silas

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t last long.....
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in Nov of 2017 and gave it to my fiancé for Christmas. Now today it won’t even work. It broke within less than a year. Very disappointing. Also it doesn’t even give me an option to message seller.....I know I bought it from the Amazon LLC or whatever but it should still give you an option....
customer_reviews.author: colleen byrnes

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality, NOT a mechanical keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: I got this keyboard thinking it was a cross between a membrane, and mechanical keyboard but I was mistaken. The quality is very good, and the keys are quiet, but you can definitely feel the difference. This is more of a typing keyboard and less of a gaming keyboard. The RGB lights are very nice looking and they hand rest is comfortable. This is good for casual gaming and paper typing, but if you are a competitive gamer stick with strictly mechanical keyboards. My package ended up getting lost, but the seller took no time to immediately send me another one.
customer_reviews.author: Darren Malone

customer_reviews.title: I love this keyboard so much
customer_reviews.text: I got this because I spend most of my day working with data in front of screens and I wanted a keyboard that felt nice to type on and had some flair to it. This keyboard is everything I hoped it would be. I'd forgotten that I could type this fast! The wrist rest is just the right height. I hadn't realized until now just how much strain my hands had been under. I love it so much I'm actually considering getting a second keyboard for at home.
customer_reviews.author: Elonna75

customer_reviews.title: Good Feel
customer_reviews.text: From coming from a brown switch mechanical keyboard this one is pretty impressive. I would say the "switch" requires a little more pressure than my browns and also has a louder click. The RGB is amazing and looks awesome next to my Razer mamba tournament edition. I don't give it a 5 because of the loud click, i like a click but for me it is a little louder than expected. As far as function and being a good quality keyboard I would give it a 5 it is just a preference thing for me. I would recommend though.
customer_reviews.author: Carly

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy if you have a Mac OS 10.15
customer_reviews.text: Have a Mac, bought this keyboard and followed the instructions to install the synapse software. After installation the software required a restart, which I did but instead the computer hung up at bootup, and would not start. I contacted Razer support and they stated that their own software causing this issue on Mac “was beyond their scope”. Utter incompetence, so you release software on your own site that causes issues but don’t support it? I had to reinstall my OS and delete the app.
customer_reviews.author: A. Ra

customer_reviews.title: other than that, Great Keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what the Dr. ordered. Kinda wish the CAPS Lock indicator was bigger and more obvious...also, my major complaint - the "W" key almost immediately wore off. Now I have a white key on my black keyboard. I contacted Razer support and ordered another (which took some doing - apparently I am the only person in the world who has had the "W" key wear off??). I sent support a picture of the key and they said they would order the part. It has now been 3 months...I am not thinking I will EVER SEE THE REPLACEMENT KEY. Subsequent inquiries have been unanswered. I will NOT order another Razer Keyboard, and do NOT recommend this product to anyone else.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Barrow

customer_reviews.title: Broke even with mild use.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard around 2 months back looking at all the reviews online and here at Amazon, it worked great at the start but it broke kind of broke today. F key doesn't work any more, and a few more keys requires multiple pushes to get registered. Luckily, I didn't threw my old keyboard and was able to get my work done. This is very unreliable. My return window is closed so I cannot even return it now and left with a $80 brick at my home now.
customer_reviews.author: Saurabh Goyal

customer_reviews.title: Glitches on keypress at random times
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard feels and looks great, but I often get into the position where I press ctrl+c or ctrl+x, or ctrl+tab where the keyboard floods my editor with spaces or erroneous symbols. Clearly the keypress registers as a hold. This usually results in me having to reach behind my computer to unplug and replug the keyboard. Outside of this functionality error (being able to type confidently), it's a great looking and feeling keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: jcohl

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: I love the feeling of the keys on this guy, very clicky without the sound. No problem supporting multiple keys at the same time and the wrist rest I found quite nice
customer_reviews.author: Josh M.

customer_reviews.title: Love It.
customer_reviews.text: I am a big fan of Razer's hybrid mechanical keys and these feel great. The detachable wrist rest is awesome too. I play with it and it makes it more comfortable in my opinion but its magnetized so its super each to remove if you prefer. The RGB lighting looks great and razer synapse software is always nice to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: PERFECTION
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS KEYBOARD OMFG. I wanted something that was a hybrid of keyboards because neither a mechanical nor a membrane felt fully right. The color customization is amazing, per every razer chroma set. The wrist wrest is actually magnetic, which is so nice because you can clean out those crumbs easily, but the wrist wrest itself is of very high quality. My favorite thing about this keyboard is that it goes into a custom lighting mode specifically made for overwatch. The colors change with the characters you pick! And in other games, it lights upt he keys that you can use. It's just perfect. 10/10 would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Ani

customer_reviews.title: Feels Mechanical; Fun Customization
customer_reviews.text: I work from home and am typing all day long. Although this is a membrane keyboard, it feels mechanical (without the price tag of your typical mechanical). The strong response in the keys is super satisfying, and I type blazing fast on it. The color effects are also very customizable and fun to play around with. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Garret S

customer_reviews.title: Great all around keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This is a great all around keyboard. My son uses it for gaming and I use it for daily use. As a former computer programmer a comfortable keyboard is a big deal. This has a comfortable wrist pad, well spaced keys and easy press to actuate. The lights and customizations available there are endless. The profile setup for each user to have their own special keysets, macros and functions is also a great customization.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Such great value for money!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Where to begin. This is by far the best for the buck you can get at the moment on any Razor gaming keyboard. The keys feel great and I have noticed that when gaming my movements are faster. You can Macro any keys you want and the lighting on here is truly easy to do and looks amazing. It comes with a wrist rest and its the best in the business. I also have the synapse and I was able to sync the lighting with it so the moments are fluent. Razor did surprisingly well with this one. I will update if there is any problems down the line.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty and it's effective!
customer_reviews.text: I have no complaints with this product. It feels great and the switches are extremely responsive. The software (Razer Synapse) is fine. It would probably be more effective if I had multiple Razer products. My RGB "mousepad" is not Razer, but a BladeHawks. Perhaps it might be possible to sync the two with third-party software. I haven't looked into it as I'm perfectly satisfied having two different rgb patterns going at once. However; that may not be your preference. If you prefer RGB synchronization, it's probably best to buy products of the same manufacture. However; that cannot be a negative in this review! This keyboard, and the software that controls it is A-OK in my book.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Good color customization and great typing platform.
customer_reviews.text: Love the Razor customization options, being able to match my keyboard to my screensaver is very cool. The Razor platform is very cool but it does take some adjusting to understand it. It was very expensive but I used a lot of gift cards so it was basically a birthday present. It is the best keyboard I have ever owned and the wrist guard is not something I knew I needed but it is greatly appreciated. The clicking of the keyboard is also not too loud but still nice and relaxing. Best keyboard ever!
customer_reviews.author: Catie Rose

customer_reviews.title: Alright keyboard, terrible Space Bar
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard is alright. It serves its purpose, is comfortable, and looks good. Problem is the single most important key is TERRIBLE. Space bar is wobbly as hell, you can push on the edges all the way down to the membrane and not register an input. As seen in the attached picture (and yes the metal pin is attached correctly). Extremely frustrating while typing, makes gaming nearly impossible without clear and easy space bar pushes. Other item to note is the magnetic wrist rest. Its good it really is, but the magnets used to attach it are very weak, can barely hold the rest in place.
customer_reviews.author: BKMagnus

customer_reviews.title: It’s good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Feels great to use. This is my fourth keyboard and I think I’ve finally found one I’m happy with. The keys are at a good hight and the buttons aren’t extremely loud when they click. It’s a moderate sound and can easily be ignored or drowned out if need be. I got angry and hit it while gameing one day and unlike others mine here didn’t have any keys brake or pop out. The quality is good and the texture is also nice and smooth
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent, but way overpriced.
customer_reviews.text: Buyer Beware: This is NOT in any way a mechanical keyboard. It is essentially your basic membrane keyboard with a little metal clicker the key caps press up against. There are much better actual mechanical keyboards with similar prices on the market. Apart from that, it's okay to type on, wrist rest is decent, custom lighting only works on computers with software installed. Also, the key caps it uses are proprietary.
customer_reviews.author: Jim.

customer_reviews.title: Great feel and look!
customer_reviews.text: Love this keyboard. I wanted a wired gaming keyboard and this has met all of my needs. I am what some would call a "filthy casual" in the gaming community but I love the colors, the feel, and the clicks of this keyboard! Just a warning, if you do not like hearing the keys as you hit them do not buy this keyboard! The key strokes are very noticeable, I normally have a gaming headset on when using it so I do not notice it (plus I like hearing the clicks anyway)
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Great for gaming and typing
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy this keyboard immensely for both gaming and typing. The custom color profiles are neat, the only downside is you must have the Razer software installed and running or you get a default color strobe. The wrist cushion is a great bonus and is very comfortable and durable
customer_reviews.author: Phillip

customer_reviews.title: An amazing product  that's worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes the lighting can get distracting. Playing some CS:GO and all the sudden my keyboard flashed and I got rushed. The timing wasn't great. So I just continued to stare at the keyboard and it made me happy. I love it and the customization I can do with Synapse is brilliant. It feels much smoother to use than any other. Plus, the wrist piece is nothing to joke around about. It has definitely helped me and will continue to help.
customer_reviews.author: Roberta

customer_reviews.title: Back-lighting not distinctive enough Cannot distinguish between lit and non lit keys!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a replacement to an original black widow Chroma as it was a bit cheaper.. Well in a word not worth it!.. the "back lighting" on the keys is so freaking bright that the entire keyboard is lit up like a Christmas tree when you are in gaming mode and only want specific keys to be lit.. It makes it near impossible to tell which keys are lit. Returned it and spent the money on the Chroma!
customer_reviews.author: Darcy Biggica

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful and reliable
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Responsive key movement -Mechanical -Razer synapse software for tracking, color management, detailed settings -Macro option -Gaming option (prevents windows key and select key combos (such as shift + tab) from working and interrupting gameplay. -Comes with magnetic (but secure) wrist pad -Colors/options stored in cloud Cons: -Required software/account for settings and color options -Dirt/grim can easily get under the keys with no easy way to get it out (pain to disassemble, compressed air only does so much)
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money, would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Great colors and feel is amazing. Love the cushion that it comes with
customer_reviews.author: ToddyA

customer_reviews.title: Great key responsiveness, strong upstroke, and tactile feel
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard feels great. Keys feel very tactile and much less 'wobbly' than most mechanical keyboards I've used. The keys on this keyboard really 'bounce back', there's no dead zone on the upstroke where you have to consciously let off the key, subtle but you'd understand if you've used a keyboard like that before. I prefer this keyboard much more than my mechanical keyboard with blue switches. Really something you have to try if you've only tried regular switches and want something new. The keys aren't too loud either though they're not exactly quiet. Keyboard lasted great for over 2 years until I spilled pepsi all over it and got a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Student

customer_reviews.title: undernath metal spring/hinges kept coming undone.
customer_reviews.text: Had to return it. The springs underneath kept coming undone! I have no idea why or if others been having this issue..though I've heard it's not been an issue.. Maybe it was just my order. The wristpad WAS AMAZING though... if it were for that alone, I'd buy again if I knew it was workign better.
customer_reviews.author: Shepherd Grei

customer_reviews.title: Tooooo loud!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was a piece of sh*t keyboard so dam loud I loosing my mind but cool looking keyboard don't buy it if you hate clicking noise
customer_reviews.author: jaewon

customer_reviews.title: Best keyboard ever hands down
customer_reviews.text: So I love the feel of.mechanical keyboards but hate the sound and height of the keys. This keyboard solves everything. The keys are mid height but still have that perfect mechanical click that doesn't feel like cheap plastic. Also the best thing about this is the detachable wrist rest. Holy shit razor was A genius for that. I will never buy another keyboard without one. I've used literally every gaming keyboard known to man just fyi.
customer_reviews.author: byah

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: I bought this keyboard when I the parts for a new computer. I have accidentally spilled water, food crumbs, and whatever else you can think of on this keyboard. Yet due to the very easy to assemble keys, it's as simple as popping them off and popping them back on. Minus, the spacebar and a couple others, which I just typically take a swab and just swab under them, keeping them clean without the hassle for dealing with those little metallic bars that are terribly difficult to put back on. I know because I had previously owned the Razer blackwidow, and lets just say it was a mistake to buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Truly Amazed
customer_reviews.text: I despise mechanical keyboards as a person coming from a laptop with chiclet keys. This keyboard has a great feel to it and the clicking isn't as bad as i thought it was going to be. the medium height keys feel great and the membrane is a lot easier to bottom out than my MacBook pro with chiclets. Very fast action for a membrane board. highly recommend for those whom also don't like high keys and annoying clicking sounds.
customer_reviews.author: Carl G

customer_reviews.title: I love this keyboard
customer_reviews.text: 08/2020 Update - All three keyboards are still working great despite heavy daily use :) I have been actively recommending this keyboard to anyone who asks 08/2019 Original Review - I have bought three of these keyboards. One for Home, one for Work, and one for my Husband at his work. My work keyboard had a weird defect where the spacebar would squeak when you pressed it but Amazon was amazing and had a new one in the mail the same day that I reported it and the replacement works just as well as my other ones. Love this keyboard <3
customer_reviews.author: A.S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Keyboard with Perfect Design Features
customer_reviews.text: I chose the Razer Ornata Keyboard simply because of my trust in Razer products for my gaming purposes. The Razer Ornata Keyboard has a very different feel to it that is the quintessential difference separating it from other keyboards. The mechanical/membrane feel of the keyboard provides a soft touch similar to that of a membrane keyboard. However, a mechanical click that reassures the user has selected the key still exists within this keyboard. The ability to use color settings provided by the Razer Synapse only furthers the appeal of this keyboard. It is a very well designed and quality piece to add to your computer desk and possibly your Razer Chroma Array.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Summers

customer_reviews.title: How to describe it haha
customer_reviews.text: This is hands down the best keyboard i have ever bought/owned. First off the clicking is way to satisfying, that and the feel of the keys is amazing. The lights were confusing at first but once i figured it all out i was able to set up a very cool light show on my keyboard where the back ground is fire colors with certain keys glowing blue (for gaming, wasd etc) and when i click a key it makes ripples go out. The arm rest is very comfortable and magnetically snaps to the keyboard so it doesnt slide around at all. This is my favorite keyboard and i would definitely recommend getting it. :D
customer_reviews.author: olo

customer_reviews.title: Amazed.
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is simply the best keyboard I have ever owned. It is an extremely satisfying typing tool with a great, smooth feel and it is highly customizable with the Razer Synapse software. It has the crisp, tactile click response of a mechanical keyboard but with the cushioned feel of a membrane keyboard. Before this, I was using a Logitech K840 mechanical keyboard. This keyboard is much lighter and much better looking, in my opinion. I highly recommend buying this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Blake B

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit and Feel
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is exactly what I wanted. Quality is great - as with every Razer product I've bought - and I love the ergonomics and flexibility of the magnetic wrist rest. The lighting effects are definitely cool, though they aren't why I purchased it. I am very much liking the hybrid mechanical/membrane keys! My wife had me add another to our shopping cart to get one for herself in the next few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Vick02

customer_reviews.title: Great but...
customer_reviews.text: I love the sound and everything about this keyboard but the space at is starting to squeak and I’ve had it for less than 2 months so kinda a bummer
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Boss

customer_reviews.title: A decent keyboard
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a Logitech keyboard. Very responsive. My only complaint that yes indeed it is loud.
customer_reviews.author: Trebor

customer_reviews.title: Cannot configure the keyboard unless you create an account and connect to a cloud system.
customer_reviews.text: I cannot believe that a lousy keyboard needs to connect to a cloud system just to use it's functions! And Razer requires you to create a user account to use the Synapse software as well! The keyboard itself seems to be of good quality, but the requirements for using the software makes it a definite non-starter. Check other makers for any similar ridiculous requirements. I'm returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: For the most part, I like this a lot. The included wrist rest is nice and plush. The keyboard itself has nice construction, the keys are satisfying to press, are sensitive, and the noise is muted compared to traditional mechanical keyboards. The included Razer Synapse software is pretty easy to work with and has a good array of RGB options to work with. My only complaint is that I wish the keys were a bit more sensitive and didn't take as much force to actuate, but that's moreso owing to my choice of keyboard rather than this being the keyboard's fault.
customer_reviews.author: G Tan

customer_reviews.title: Eh... Could be better.
customer_reviews.text: The lighting is pretty, and the keys travel very nicely. However, the mech-membrand switches are dreadful. They are loud, and after a while of daily use, they begin to lose their tactile feel and start to feel more like plain rubber domes. For instance, my WASD keys are quieter and mushy, while my arrow keys are loud and clicky. I will most likely replace this board in the coming months. Moral of the story: Eother go for domes or go for mechanical switches, not some horrid amalgamation of the two.
customer_reviews.author: Billy S.

customer_reviews.title: meh
customer_reviews.text: so I got it after I was not happy with the Red Dragon. Red Dragon did not have clicky keys which I like, and the L key was not registering strokes.. this one seems cheaper built - the Red Dragon had an aluminum base, was heavier and seemed better built. The magnetic wrist pad seems cool. so far my issue with it is if you hit the left edge of the backspace key (long key for a reason) it does not register the stroke. I also seem to be making a LOT more spelling errors (mainly missing letters) than usual. prob return this one too..
customer_reviews.author: Concerned Citizen

customer_reviews.title: A nearly flawless entry "mechanical" keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Bought this at a sale price and it works quite well. The keys produce a nice "tack" sound that is fairly loud but not overly so. The RGB chroma is beautiful. I can't stop looking at it. Enjoy the wrist rest area. My typing speed has remained the same and feel comfortable typing all day long on this.
customer_reviews.author: Christian B.

customer_reviews.title: Razer has made the comfort benchmark
customer_reviews.text: Coming from Red Dragon keyboards, it so nice to gain ergonomic comfort. My favorite part is the coating on the keys. This keyboard has a light mechanical like clicking sound which I found more enjoyable than my previous silent key. The backlight is very bright and this is adjustable if you prefer something more discrete. Razer never compromises on their quality. I am continuing to put together a collection of their products. Also, love the stickers that come with every product.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Looks great however..
customer_reviews.text: The Razer Ornata is a great looking keyboard with a major flaw with gaming. Pros: -great looking keyboard with lighting and customization -very comfortable ergonomic wrist pad Cons: -lighting has repeatedly reset back to default requiring reopening the software to use customized settings -it is way too loud for gaming unless you exclusively use headphones - for immersive games it is a deal breaker Sadly I love the way it looks, but it is just too loud for how I use it.
customer_reviews.author: ayoung

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I actually stepped down from a Blackwidow Chroma V2 because I love the feel of this keyboard so much. Key's are definitely more stiff than a standard mechanical keyboard, and with it's shorty push distance it feels very clicky and tactile. I love it. And since you can get the Green LED version for a mere $40, this is (In My Opinion) the best budget keyboard available
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Skeith

customer_reviews.title: NOT Supported w/ Synapse 2 therefore will not work on MacOS devices
customer_reviews.text: Hello, Originally purchased for my work computer desk which is a PC. Great keyboard, nothing bad to say other than that when I want to use it on my macbook pro it won't register the device. No MacOS support. Says it supports Synapse 2 but in fact does not. So if you're not using only PC don't buy. Otherwise great.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda M

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Soft RGB light keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing keyboard with lots of colors. The keyboard automatically interacts with many games like Overwatch changing color pallet depending on the character you are playing and also alerting you to when your Ultimate is up by pulsing. The wrist rest is very soft and a must have for any gamer.
customer_reviews.author: Casshern

customer_reviews.title: This keyboard is great and in a reasonable price range
customer_reviews.text: I used to game on the 10 dollar cheap keyboard then upgraded to the Razer death stalker, then the Red dragon mechanical keyboard. It is a balance between the click and tactile feel but not loud enough where your microphone picks it up in my discord. The quality of life on the keyboard is nice with the magnetic wrist rest. If you have the money, I would highly recommend it! Also the lights are very nice, I set up a purple and green fire effect and it’s calming and awesome looking.
customer_reviews.author: Kent

customer_reviews.title: Average product
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes I need to manually unplug n plug to get keyboard lights on. Apart of that everything is good I can say avg product
customer_reviews.author: Nikhil Kalyan

customer_reviews.title: Good keyboard, software could use some help
customer_reviews.text: I had a very loud, clicky mechanical keyboard before this. I recently bought a more sensitive mic and I knew I needed something quieter. If you are looking for completely silent then this isn't for you, BUT I am happy with it as it is a lot quieter compared to what I had before. Also, it still gives the touch feeling I prefer when gaming. Rating 4 stars because the software it comes with is a little clunky and it needs to be on in order to control the lighting. Without the software it just continously cycles through colors and is pretty distracting.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky

customer_reviews.title: left shift doesn't work anymore in just 30 days
customer_reviews.text: It really disappointed me. I've just used for 29 days, and the left shift key doesn't work anymore. It's a defective keyboard, but it passed the return date. However, I contacted them, and they replaced me one and include shipping, even though I got a defect. It still a nice keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: natec

customer_reviews.title: ... this keyboard for a while now and am very pleased with the keys and their feel
customer_reviews.text: Been using this keyboard for a while now and am very pleased with the keys and their feel. Color options are nice and they update the software all the time. the wrist rest for this keyboard is what has to be the most comfortable one I have yet to own, and I love the fact that it is magnetically joined instead of using tabs. I don't do a lot of gaming with it (old guy) but it serves me well when I do. I went back to a wired keyboard as the wireless models I was using just had to much lag for my tastes.
customer_reviews.author: D. E. Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Lack of Attachment Support
customer_reviews.text: I love this keyboard, but the lack of support razer has for it is actually super unfortunate. I've been using it for close to a year and half now and I've had no problems with it at all until my wrist rest started deteriorating at the spot my left palm rests. After contacting razer support, they told me they no longer sell the attachment separate - a huge disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Hu

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and ergonomic
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th and probably least expensive keyboard (was $50 when purchased) and somehow i like it best. Nice and tactile, and beautiful yet ergonomic design. Note, they keys are slightly louder than charry mx blue or razer green switches
customer_reviews.author: Nick

product_meta.title: Razer Ornata Chroma Gaming Keyboard: Hybrid Mechanical Key Switches - Customizable Chroma RGB Lighting - Individually Backlit Keys - Detachable Plush Wrist Rest - Programmable Macro Functionality
product_meta.description: Size:Keyboard| Style:Ornata ChromaThe Razer Ornata Chroma features the all-new Razer Mecha-Membrane that combines the best of both membrane rubber domes and mechanical switches to deliver a typing experience unlike anything before. While traditional rubber dome keyboards are known for their soft cushioned touch, they fail to deliver accurate tactility due to their mushy feel and lack of actuation control. On the other hand, mechanical switches deliver fast actuations and distinct tactile feedback but cause fatigue during extended gaming sessions.
feature_bullets: High-Performance Mecha-Membrane Switches Provides the tactile feedback of mechanical key press on a comfortable soft-cushioned membrane rubber dome switch suitable for gaming

Ultimate Personalization & Gaming Immersion with Razer Chroma Fully syncs with popular games Razer hardware Philips Hue and gear from 30+ partners supports 16 8 million colors on individually backlit keys
Fully Programmable Macro Support Razer Hypershift allows for all keys and keypress combinations to be remapped to execute complex commands
Ergonomic Magnetic Wrist Rest Made of soft-touch leatherette to maximize comfort over extended gaming sessions with built-in magnets for convenient alignment
Durable Construction Supports up to 80 million clicks backed by a 2-year

The #1 Best-Selling Gaming Peripherals Manufacturer in the US Source - The NPD Group U S Retail Tracking Service Keyboards Mice PC Headset/Pc Microphone Gaming Designed based on dollar sales Jan 2017- Dec 2019

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars3,589 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
